intro: Cullumia ciliata, commonly known as the fringed cullumia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant is known for its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, yellow to orange disk flowers. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in scrublands and chaparral habitats. Cullumia ciliata is adapted to drought conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
